Description: Terracotta figure of a cow with horns and ears, but no facial features represented. Fragment of head only. Solid and handmade. Soft, pale orange-pink fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Close parallel from Rhodes dated to the late 7th or early 6th century BC (Higgins 1970, no.2). The style resembles the Rhodian example and not standard Egyptian variants, and the fabric could be Rhodian (but this is not certain and it could potentially be locally produced).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.016) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5837 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
